member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Framework.TngnWsvcFramework
member.summary: High-level logic and common methods for the Tingen Web Service framework
member.remarks: For more information about Outpost31, please see the file.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Framework.TngnWsvcFramework.TngnWsvcDataFolder
member.remarks:
This folder is located on the hosting server, typically on the root of the C-drive and contains all the data/resources necessary for the Tingen Web Service to operate, including:
Session logs
Blueprints and translation tables.
Log files.
Each Avatar System that the Tingen Web Service interfaces with has it's own sub-folder, and the data in these folders are typically not directly available to users and/or Avatar.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Framework.TngnWsvcFramework.TngnWsvcWwwFolder
member.remarks:
This folder is located on the hosting server, typically on the root of the C-drive and contains the Tingen Web Service. Each Avatar System that the Tingen Web Service interfaces with has it's own sub-folder, which is directly available to Avatar.
In general, users should not need to directly access this folder.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.TingenWsvcSession.TngnWsvcSessionError
member.summary: Handles errors that occur during a Tingen Web Service session.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.TingenWsvcSession.TngnWsvcSessionError.HardError(Outpost31.Core.TingenWsvcSession.TngnWsvcSession,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Logs a hard error, updates the session log, and sends an error response to the client.
member.remarks:
This method performs the following actions:
Logs the error details using the session's trace log settings.
Appends the error message and relevant parameters to the session's running log.
Sends the error code and message back to the client as part of the response. Ensure that the parameter is properly initialized before calling this method.
member.param: The object that contains all the information for this session.
The OptionObject error code.
The OptionObject error message.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Translation.FormId
member.summary: Provides functionality for retrieving form names based on form IDs and managing related metadata.
member.remarks: This class includes methods and properties for working with form identifiers and their associated names. It is designed for internal use and relies on a translation file to map form IDs to form names.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Translation.FormId.GetFormName(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieves the name of a form based on its identifier from a translation file.
member.remarks: The method reads a translation file named "form_id-form_name.trans" located in the specified directory. Each line in the file is expected to have the format "formId=formName". If the specified matches the left-hand side of a line, the corresponding form name is returned. If no match is found, the default value "WSVC2491" is returned.
member.param: The unique identifier of the form to look up.
The directory path where the translation file is located.
The folder associated with the current session, used for logging purposes.
The maximum number of trace log entries to retain.
member.returns: The name of the form if found in the translation file; otherwise, the default value "WSVC2491".

member.remarks: e.g., JDOE becomes John Doe

member.returns: The full name of the user associated with the specified avatar username.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Translation.UserId.CreateTranslationFile(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a translation file by reading and processing the contents of the specified original file.
member.remarks: This method reads all non-empty lines from the original file, trims any leading or trailing whitespace, and writes the processed content to a new file named "user_id-user_description.trans" in the specified directory.
member.param: The full path to the original file to be read and processed. Cannot be null or empty.
The directory path where the translation file will be created. Cannot be null or empty.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarEnvironment
member.remarks:
An Avatar environment consists of two components: the Avatar System and Avatar System Code.
While both contain the word system, they are not the same, and it is extremely important to understand the difference between the two.
For more information about Outpost31, please see the file.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarEnvironment.AvatarSystem
member.summary: The Avatar System that the Tingen Web Service will interface with.
member.remarks:
Common Avatar Systems include SBOX, UAT, and LIVE.
To modify the AvatarSystem that the Tingen Web Service will interface with :
Open theWeb.Config file located in the root directory of the Tingen Web Service.
Locate the AvatarSystem setting within the applicationSettings section.
Change the value of AvatarSystem setting to the desired value.
Save the changes to the Web.Config file.
For example, to set the Avatar System to `LIVE`:
< setting name="AvatarSystem" serializeAs="String"> <value>LIVE</value> </setting>
Changes to the AvatarSystem setting will be applied the next time the Tingen Web Service is executed.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarEnvironment.AvatarSystemCode
member.summary: The Avatar System Code used to login to Avatar.
member.remarks:
Avatar System Codes are specific to each organization and environment, and often mirror that organization's .
Common Avatar Systems include SBOX, UAT, and LIVE.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject
member.remarks:
The Avatar OptionObject holds all of the content of and metadata describing the calling myAvatar form.
The Avatar OptionObject contains:
The Avatar System in use(SBOX, LIVE, etc.)
The Avatar user name that is logged in.
The form fields, and their values
And more!
The Tingen Web Service uses three types of OptionObjects:
Type Description
Original The original OptionObject sent from Avatar, which is never modified by the Tingen Web Service.
Worker The OptionObject where work is done, which is potentially modified during a Tingen Web Service session.
Completed The OptionObject that is returned to Avatar at the end of the Tingen Web Service session. Typically the Return OptionObject is the same as the Worker OptionObject, but required components have been verified.
For more information about Avatar OptionObjects, please see
For more information about Outpost31, please see the file.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject.Original
member.summary: The original OptionObject sent from Avatar.
member.remarks: The original OptionObject is never modified by the Tingen Web Service.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject.Worker
member.summary: The OptionObject where work is done.
member.remarks: The worker OptionObject is potentially modified by the Tingen Web Service.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject.Completed
member.summary: The finalized OptionObject that is returned to Avatar.
member.remarks: The completed OptionObject is a copy of the worker OptionObject that has been prepared for returning to Avatar.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject.VerifyExistence(ScriptLinkStandard.Objects.OptionObject2015)
member.summary: Verify if an OptionObject was sent from Avatar.
member.remarks: No logging done here because the logging functionality isn't setup yet.
member.param: The original OptionObject sent from Avatar.
member.returns: A string indicating if an OptionObject was sent or not.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarOptionObject.ToReturn(Outpost31.Core.TingenWsvcSession.TngnWsvcSession,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Completes an OptionObject in preparation to be returned to Avatar.
member.remarks:
In order to successfully return an OptionObject to Avatar:
The OptionObject must be set.
The most common error codes are:
1 - Used when you don't want the user to take an action, such as submitting a form.
3 - Used when you would like to notify the user of something.
4 - Used when you want warn the user they may want to make changes, and give them the option to stop further processing,or continuing.
The OptionObject Error Message must be set.
The message that is displayed to the user.
All OptionObject components must be validated and formatted correctly.
This is done via .
member.param: The that contains all the information for this session.
The OptionObject .
The OptionObject Error Message that is displayed to the user.

member.name: T:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarScriptParameter
member.remarks:
The Avatar Script Parameter is a string that is sent from Avatar that contains a Request that tells the Tingen Web Service what to do.
For more information about Outpost31, please see the file.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarScriptParameter.OriginalScriptParameter
member.summary: The original Script Parameter sent from Avatar.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarScriptParameter.VerifyExistence(System.String)
member.summary: Verify if a Script Parameter was sent from Avatar.
member.remarks: No logging done here because the logging functionality isn't setup yet.
member.param: The original sent from Avatar.
member.returns: A custom string indicating if an Script Parameter was sent or not.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarScriptParameter.Parse(Outpost31.Core.TingenWsvcSession.TngnWsvcSession)
member.remarks:
There are two types of Script Parameter requests:
_{Request}
Requests that start with an underscore use functionality based on the form being used.
For example, using the _FormLoad Script Parameter on the OpenIncident form will trigger the FormLoad() event inthe OpenIncident Module.
To determine what form is used when the Script Parameter starts with an underscore, the form ID is looked up in .
{Request}
Requests that do not start with an underscore are use stand-alone functionality that is not dependent on the form being used.
member.param: The that contains all the information for this session.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarScriptParameter.FormSpecificRequest(System.String,Outpost31.Core.TingenWsvcSession.TngnWsvcSession)
member.summary: Parses the specified form name and performs the corresponding action based on its value.
member.remarks: If the is "WSVC2491", a hard error is logged indicating that the form ID was not found in the translation table. For "OpenIncident", the method delegates to the OpenIncidentRequest.Parse method to handle the request. For other form names, a trace log entry is created without additional actions.
member.param: The name of the form to parse. This determines the action to be performed.
The object that contains all the information for this session.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Core.Avatar.AvatarScriptParameter.StandAloneRequest(Outpost31.Core.TingenWsvcSession.TngnWsvcSession)
member.remarks:
A "static" request is one that does not change based on the form being used.
If the static request is not found, log a hard error.
member.param: The object that contains all the information for this session.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Maintenance.DailyMaintenance.RefreshTranslationTables(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Refreshes the translation tables by ensuring the necessary translation files are updated or recreated.
member.remarks: This method ensures that the translation tables are up-to-date by verifying the existence of specific translation files and recreating them if necessary. It also logs the process for traceability.
member.param: The path to the directory containing the generated data files.
The path to the directory where translation files are stored.
The global trace log limit.
The current session folder.

member.name: M:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentQuery.GetCurrentUserRoles(Outpost31.Core.TingenWsvcSession.TngnWsvcSession)
member.summary: Executes a query to retrieve the authorized user role/
member.remarks: The query execution is determined by the environment specified in the . Supported environments include "LIVE", "UAT", and "SBOX". Each environment uses a specific query implementation. If the environment is not recognized, an error message is returned.
member.param: The object that contains all the information for this session.
member.returns: A string containing the result of the query execution.

member.summary: Executes a query to get the User Description of an Avatar UserID
member.remarks: The query execution is determined by the environment specified in the . Supported environments include "LIVE", "UAT", and "SBOX". Each environment uses a specific query implementation. If the environment is not recognized, an error message is returned.
member.param: The object that contains all the information for this session.
member.returns: A string containing the result of the query execution.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.Mode
member.remarks:
The following modes are supported:
Enabled: All OpenIncident Module functionality is available.
Disabled: None of the OpenIncident Module functionality is available.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.Whitelist
member.summary: List of Avatar Usernames that can always use this functionality.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.Greylist
member.summary: List of Avatar Usernames that will ignore this functionality.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.Blacklist
member.summary: List of Avatar Usernames that are restricted from using this functionality.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.BriefIncidentDescriptionFieldId
member.summary: The FieldID containing the brief description of the incident.
member.remarks:
This field is used to determine if the incident report is a new report or an existing report being modified.
New reports will have this field empty, while existing reports will have this field populated.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.ProgramOfIncidentFieldId
member.summary: The FieldID containing the Program of Incident.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.PersonCompletingIncidentFormFieldId
member.summary: The FieldID containing the Avatar Username that originally completed the form.
member.remarks:
The value in this field matches the "User Description" field in the Avatar User Definition form.
Since the OptionObject that is passed to the Tingen Web Service only contains the Avatar User ID (OptionObject.OptionUserId), we need to translate the Avatar User ID (e.g., "UNAME") to the Avatar User Description (e.g., "User Name").

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.NotMemberOfAuthorizedUserRoleMsg
member.summary: The message to display when the form is opened by a user that is not a member of an AuthorizedUserRole.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.NotMemberOfAuthorizedUserRoleErrCode
member.summary: Error Code to return when the form is opened by a user that is not a member of an AuthorizedUserRole..

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.NotOriginalAuthorOpenMsg
member.summary: Message to display when the form is opened by a user that did not originally complete the form.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.NotOriginalAuthorOpenErrCode
member.summary: Error Code to return when the form is opened by a user that did not originally complete the form.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.NotOriginalAuthorSubmitMsg
member.summary: Message to display when the form is opened by a user that did not originally complete the form.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.NotOriginalAuthorSubmitErrCode
member.summary: Error Code to return when the form is submitted by a user that did not originally complete the form.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.InvalidProgramOfIncidentMsg
member.summary: Message to display when the Program of Incident specified is not valid.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.InvalidProgramOfIncidentErrCode
member.summary: Error Code to return when the Program of Incident specified is not valid.

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.UnknownUserDescriptionMsg
member.summary: Message to display when value of the PersonCompletingIncidentForm field cannot be found in Avatar.
member.remarks: Since the OptionObject that is passed to the Tingen Web Service only contains the Avatar User ID (OptionObject.OptionUserId), we need to translate the Avatar User ID (e.g., "UNAME") to the Avatar User Description (e.g., "User Name").

member.name: P:Outpost31.Module.OpenIncident.OpenIncidentConfig.UnknownUserDescriptionErrCode
member.summary: Error code to return when value of the PersonCompletingIncidentForm field cannot be found in Avatar.
member.remarks: Since the OptionObject that is passed to the Tingen Web Service only contains the Avatar User ID (OptionObject.OptionUserId), we need to translate the Avatar User ID (e.g., "UNAME") to the Avatar User Description (e.g., "User Name").

remarks.para:
About the Tingen Web Service
Netsmart's Avatar is a behavioral health EHR that offers a recovery-focused suite of solutions that leverage real-time analytics and clinical decision support to drive value-based care.
While Avatar is a robust platform, it isn't perfect. The good news is that you can extend myAvatar functionality via Netsmart's Avatar Web Services, and/or custom web services that are written by other Avatar users.
The Tingen Web Service is one such custom web service which includes various tools and utilities for Avatar that aren't included in the official release, and provides a solid foundation for building additional functionality quickly and efficiently.
About Outpost31
Outpost31 is the back-end logic for the Tingen Web Service.
